comments.body:
as far as I can tell the only usage of the `RangesBuilder` class is at Node.py:632 where this is called:

```Python
RangesBuilder(self).build_ranges()
```

If this is the only way `RangesBuilder` is used, why does it need properties at all?

Indeed, it doesn't. Since the RangesBuilder class will be removed in the next PR, I would leave it like this if it's ok with you. Otherwise for this PR I can put a check `if isinstance(self._headnode, TreeHeadNode)` in the RangesBuilder `__init__` function and set the right attributes accordingly
we can leave it like this but please add a FIXME/TODO mentioning that `RangesBuilder` should probably just be a free function
